Recent Boston Beef and Seafood Reviews A diner from PSJ gave an overall rating of on January 9, 2012 @ 10:00 PM
The food is OVER priced and NOT worth it. If you want a REAL dinner go to Boston Fish House in Winter Park. The food there is tasty and fresh and ALWAYS yummy. The menu stated a scallop basket was 14.95, but the bill showed it as 17.95.. NOT worth it. The food was cold, the french fries were OLD, the 3 onion rings didn't make me feel better for having been ripped off from 14.95 to 17.95 for over-cooked, tasteless scallops...The place is a REAL JOKE!!!! Take the drive to Winter Park and eat REAL seafood at Boston Fish House on Aloma..... Do NOT waste your money at Boston Beef and Seafood..... I have given them "several" tries" and the food remains tasteless, over priced and garbage.... Last week was my LAST chance for them and I told them I was over it when they jumped up the price on the "tiny" meal by four dollars....no notice, no nothing..uh uh.. time for that place to close up...the food SUCKED and I was very unhappy. NO more... A diner from Orlando, FL (owning a condo in Cape Canaveral) gave an overall rating of on April 10, 2010 @ 11:11 PM
Born and raised in Massachusetts, loving the Red Sox, and all good seafood. Moved to Florida almost 30 years ago and found Boston's a few years ago ---- it's like being home again and the food is fantastic! The haddock I used to remember back home is even better here. I'm in love with the fried clams, scallops and oysters. You can't go wrong. The service was fantasic, folksy and attentive. You are made to feel comfortable and welcome and get a great meal for your dollars. » Read More Boston Beef and Seafood Reviews
